intro: Cynoglossum glochidiatum, commonly known as the hairy bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in late summer. Cynoglossum glochidiatum is often grown as an ornamental plant in gardens due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
